text: A man is not called wise because he talks and talks again; but if he is peaceful, loving and fearless then he is in truth called wise
author: Gautama Buddha

text: Yesterday I was clever, so I wanted to change the world. Today I am wise, so I am changing myself
author: Rumi

text: This is my simple religion. No need for temples. No need for complicated philosophy. Your own mind, your own heart is the temple. Your philosophy is simple kindness
author: Dalai Lama XIV

text: Your time is limited, so don’t waste it living someone else’s life
author: Steve Jobs

text: God gave us the gift of life; it is up to us to give ourselves the gift of living well
author: Voltaire

text: You can never plan the future by the past
author: Edmund Burke

text: Be happy for this moment. This moment is your life
author: Omar Khayyam

text: Just as a snake sheds its skin, we must shed our past over and over again
author: Gautama Buddha

text: You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough
author: Mae West

text: Be like a tree and let the dead leaves drop
author: Rumi

text: Understanding is the first step to acceptance
author: J.K. Rowling

text: People generally see what they look for, and hear what they listen for
author: Harper Lee

text: Wise men make more opportunities than they find
author: Francis Bacon.

text: Forgiveness is the final form of love
author: Reinhold Niebuhr

text: Life is a succession of lessons which must be lived to be understood
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Life is a question and how we live it is our answer
author: Gary Keller

text: It is better to be hated for what you are than to be loved for what you are not
author: Andre Gide

text: When a thing is done, it’s done. Don’t look back. Look forward to your next objective
author: George C. Marshall

text: Things change. And friends leave. Life doesn’t stop for anybody
author: Stephen Chbosky.

text: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated
author: Confucius

text: Think like a man of action and act like a man of thought
author: Henri Bergson.

text: It’s easier to be wise for others than for yourself
author: R.J. Lawrence

text: If you do not have control over your mouth, you will not have control over your future
author: Germany Kent
